subject: Delegation of Powers to Regional Officers; NHAI for approval of Resources for Site Clearance; Removal/Demolition of Structure falling within Project ROW & Securing of ROW after taking Possession under 3(E) of NH Act; 1956- reg.
text: "Ray 7c4 <THPf gfeabro (Tsw 4Rae- 8 RTHNf HATT4,  HRT FIFR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) arqta T 0i-5 Q 6, #az7-10, GRQ, 7f farit 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 TH/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI/ Policy Guidelines/ Land Acquisition/ 2025 Policy Circular No.7.1.81/ 2025 dated 01st January, 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. LADIV-11021/2/2024-COORD Division (Comp. No. 267694)} Sub: Delegation of Powers to Regional Officers, NHAI for approval of Resources for Site Clearance, Removal/Demolition of Structure falling within Project ROW & Securing of ROW after taking Possession under 3(E) of NH Act, 1956- reg: Ref.: j) Policy Matter-Technical (203/2016) dated 30.03.2016 (ii)  Clause 3.10 of MoRTH LA Manual (iii) Policy Guideline No.18.24/2017 dated 21.08.2017 (iv) Addendum Policy Guidelines 18.60 dated 05.01.2021 It is the responsibility of NHAI to provide encumbrance free land to the Concessionaires/Contractors within the time prescribed in the Concession Agreement or in the Contract Agreement: In some of the contracts there in no provision or inadequate provision regarding site clearance, removal / demolition of structure falling within Project ROW & Securing of ROW. 2  In connection with the above, Clause 3.10 (ii) of LA Manual issued by MoRTH states that "Project Implementing Agencies should immediately upon announcement of the Award proceed to take physical possession of land, followed by clearing & grubbing of such acquired land including trenching at the edges of RoW, by mechanical means using the Graders, Dozers, Excavators, etc.= However, no procedure is prescribed for method of taking over of physical possession. 3 The delegation of powers to Regional Officers, NHAI was further extended vide Policy Guideline No.7.1.51 dated 10.04.2017 and Policy Guideline No.18.24/2017 dated 21.08.2017 and its addendum Policy Guidelines 18.60 dated 05.01.2021 for approval of resources for the above-mentioned purpose to take Possession under 3(E) of NH Act, 1956 so as to handover land within ROW without any hindrance to the Concessionaires/Contractors. However, same has been found to be inadequate: 4_ Therefore, it is required to fill the procedural gap in Land Acquisition process between payment of   compensation and aforesaid possession of land by Project   Implementing Agency. Accordingly , a supporting activity for Possession of Land & securing of ROW" is introduced between the passing of the 3G award and the award of work (LOA)/ Appointed Date (AD) , to mitigate challenges related to possession of land; leading to delays, de-linking/ de-scoping of stretches: Contd__2I- 'a { U 9 NHAI
